Ohio Natural Health

Naturopathic, Acupuncture, and Traditional Chinese Medicine provider serving the greater Cleveland Ohio area

item.title: Columbia Researchers Find Biological Explanation for Wheat Sensitivity - Columbia University Medical Center
item.description:
Columbia Researchers Find Biological Explanation for Wheat Sensitivity - Columbia University Medical Center

NEW YORK, NY (July 26, 2016)-A new study may explain why people who do not have celiac disease or wheat allergy nevertheless experience a variety of gastrointestinal and extra-intestinal symptoms after ingesting wheat and related cereals. The findings suggest that these individuals have a weakened intestinal barrier, which leads to a body-wide inflammatory immune response.

item.title: 13 Vitamins Map Infographic
item.description:
13 Vitamins Map Infographic

Are you aware of what vitamins are necessary for your healthy life? It is very important to know at least some general information about vitamins in order to prevent a deficiency.

item.title: Acupuncture Found Effective For Angina Pectoris Relief
item.description:
Acupuncture Found Effective For Angina Pectoris Relief

Acupuncture reduces the frequency and intensity of angina, facilitates decreases in medication dosage levels, and prevents resistance to drug therapy efficaciousness. A team of eight researchers conclude that acupuncture is safe and effective for the treatment of stable angina. Wading through the sea of medical research is challenging for anyone.

item.title: What Men Should Know About Naturopathic Doctors -
item.description:
What Men Should Know About Naturopathic Doctors -

There is a lot of confusion as to who Naturopathic Doctors are and what they do. I've heard some outrageous things: we practice voo-doo and pseudo-science we don't use research or evidence-based medicine we aren't trained licensed doctors we are homeopaths we are tree-hugging, crystal healing, snake oil using hippies and the list goes on.

item.title: President of SCNM Speaks on Naturopathic Medicine Principles
item.description:
President of SCNM Speaks on Naturopathic Medicine Principles

President of Southwest College of Naturopathic Medicine, Dr. Paul Mittman speaks on the Individualized approach to healing through Naturopathic Medicine.

item.title: Fiber-dense chia seeds a nutritional powerhouse
item.description:
Fiber-dense chia seeds a nutritional powerhouse

Tiny but mighty, chia seeds pack a powerful punch. Chia seeds are gluten-free, fiber dense, high in protein and are a good source of omega 3 fatty acid, said Dr. Robert Kuyper, a naturopathic doctor with Alternative Health Care Center of the Black Hills. Fiber and omega 3 help reduce inflammation in the body, Kuyper said.

item.title: Fish Oil May Improve Post-MI Recovery
item.description:
Fish Oil May Improve Post-MI Recovery

High-dose omega-3 fatty acids after MI improved function of the heart and reduced scarring in the undamaged muscle as well as markers of systemic inflammation, the OMEGA-REMODEL randomized clinical trial showed.

item.title: Wrestling with Slander
item.description:
Wrestling with Slander

Jeff Clark, ND You may have noticed in 1 or more recent online articles that an effort seems to be in play to categorically discredit licensed naturopathic doctors. The public detractors are a tiny group of zealots who promote "science-based medicine" with a kind of religious fervor.

item.title: Cupping Marks Dot Phelps, Other Team USA Athletes
item.description:
Cupping Marks Dot Phelps, Other Team USA Athletes

Eagle-eyed Olympic observers probably noticed on Saturday those small, circular marks on the backs and shoulders of several Team USA athletes, including members of the men's gymnastics team and even all-world swimmer Michael Phelps. Those circles are the end product of a healing technique called cupping.
